name: Vietnamese Crispy Salt and Pepper Shrimp with Five Spice (Tôm Rang Muối)
description: A delicious fried shrimp appetizer that's crispy, flavorful, and best of all, easy to make. This recipe is perfect for a party or holiday appetizer.
keywords: tôm chiên muối tiêu, tôm rang muối tiêu, tôm chiên, tôm rang, tom chien, tom rang, tom chien muoi, tom chien muoi tieu, tom rang muoi, tom rang muoi tieu, crispy salt and pepper shrimp, Vietnamese salt and pepper shrimp with bouillon powder, Vietnamese salt and pepper shrimp recipe, crispy salt and pepper shrimp recipe, crispy shrimp recipe, shrimp recipe, Asian shrimp recipe, Vietnamese shrimp recipe, fry shrimp recipe, Vietnamese fried shrimp recipe, salt and pepper shrimp, fried salt and pepper shrimp, how to make salt and pepper shrimp, what is salt and pepper shrimp made of, Vietnamese spice mixture for fried shrimp, Vietnamese spice mixture for fried protein, Vietnamese spice mixture for fried food, salt and pepper shrimp with five spice powder, salt and pepper shrimp with five spice, salt and pepper shrimp with Chinese fried spice, easy salt and pepper shrimp recipe, easy salt and pepper shrimp
recipeIngredient: 1 lb shrimp (about 12 21/25 size large devein shrimp; head tail optional)
¼ teaspoon chicken bouillon powder (see notes)
recipeInstructions: Fill a large wok or skillet 2 inches high with vegetable oil and heat to 375°F. If you don't have a thermometer, drop a speck of cornstarch or insert a wooden chopstick into the oil. If it sizzles and bubbles around the cornstarch or chopstick, the oil is ready.

In a medium bowl, toss the shrimp with cornstarch until covered. Dust off any excess cornstarch. Carefully add the floured shrimp to the oil, one at a time to prevent sticking. Cook for 2-3 minutes or until golden brown and crispy. Transfer the shrimp to a wire rack or a plate lined with paper towels to drain off excess oil. Transfer the fried shrimp to a large bowl and set aside.

In a small bowl, combine the salt, chicken bouillon powder, five spice powder, garlic powder, and ground black pepper. Starting with half of the seasoning mixture, sprinkle it over the freshly fried shrimp. Toss to combine. Add more of the seasoning mixture if needed. Serve immediately for best results.
